totalitarianism I must protest!" But he likes to go down to the Piazza Venezia,
put one hand on his hip as iluaaolinl used to do on the balcony, and harangue
a rally of the political heirs of XI Dues.
Well, that is the way the bank of the Italian Chamber of Deputies looked
to this reporter during the late January debate on the Fanfani government. It
is pretty much the way the Chamber will look until it is reconstituted after
new elections.
I’d like to describe highlights of that significant January debate for
you in a subsequent Letter from Italy. This is Graham Hovay, signing another
radio letter from Italy. This program was recorded in the Rome studios of
fladiotelevlslone Italians for the National Association of Educational Broad¬
casters — and this is the NAEB Network.
